h2.b: Unleash the Power of Splunk on Finances Management

html.h3: With the advances of technology and Big Data Analytics, it is now easy to keep a check on your finances. As easy as 1-2-3..!

ol.li: Keep a track of your or your Company's Finances in an Excel or Take an Export from your Finance Reporting Tool.

Categorize Income into various Types:
Salary - Your fixed Salary (in case of personal use) or Sale (in case of company)
Interest - Any Interest which may or may not be a steady income source
Bonus - Any Extra Income is always welcome!

Also, further categorize Expenses into 3 Types:
Category A - Which are inevitable
Category B - Which may not be entirely avoidable. But can have a bit of discretion!
Category C - Which can be avoided with reasonable discretion!
Provide Details and Amount Spent / Earned / Received.
Save the Excel as CSV and Load into Splunk as per the format with sourcetype = 'FinanceTracker' or place them in the Directory which Splunk is monitoring.

You can also upload your other statements like Credit Card Statements, Equity Holdings and your other Financial Statements. Make sure that your Input have the below columns or are re-mapped in Splunk through Alias:
Type - With data as Income/Expenditure
Category - Category A / B / C for Expenses as explained above or Salary / Interest / Bonus for Income
Details - Text Details of your Income / Expense
Value - Monetary value of the transaction
Build up quick charts, pivots to analyse the finances and take control!
